column3:
@laanwj Any idea what is causing this build error, I don't understand the problem.

Edit: Was caused by paymentservertest.cpp, because Gavin called eventFilter() directly, which isn't possible anymore after this pull.

Damn:

<pre>
paymentservertests.cpp: In function SendCoinsRecipient handleRequest(PaymentServer*, std::vector<unsigned char, std::allocator<unsigned char> >&):
paymentservertests.cpp:49: error: no matching function for call to QCoreApplication::sendEvent(QObject&, QFileOpenEvent&)
/usr/include/qt4/QtCore/qcoreapplication.h:214: note: candidates are: static bool QCoreApplication::sendEvent(QOb
I hope this is the last time now -_-.\n
@laanwj Merge-ready or anything more to be done here?\n
If @BitcoinPullTester is happy, this should be merge-ready @laanwj.\n

Automatic sanity-testing: PASSED, see http://jenkins.bluematt.me/pull-tester/4cf3411056f6a59fc5fe07784b6b6a512d76b046 for binaries and test log.\nThis test script verifies pulls every time they are updated. It, however, dies sometimes and fails to test properly.  If you are waiting on a test, please check timestamps to verify that the test.log is moving at http://jenkins.bluematt.me/pull-tester/cu
This is meant to be a test of the event filter, don't replace it with a direct call to handleURIOrFile.\nAren't there other ways to submit events to an object?\n
I didn't really care to investigate, as it was already an ugly construct before... do you prefer to keep this (and make eventFilter public again) or to find a better way?\n
The only objective here is to deliver the event to the object, yes please find another way no matter how ugly it would be in real code, it's a test so that's allowed.\n
I hope that new code works ;).\n
Nice solution, hope it works too\n
Why remove this comment? AFAIK this is correct, only on Mac the URIs and such come in through this way\n
By mistake, a former pull extended this function, which made the comment wrong, don't mind, I changed it back.\n
